result.execSummary:
The defendant Othel S Garland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
AS TO EACH  COUNT: Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Batterers Intervention program, or a course in anger management, based on evaluation.
Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Othel S Garland
Current: 1710 W. Atkinson Ave. Apt 104, Milwaukee, WI 53206 United States  (Effective: 08-30-2016)
Prior: 2645 North 22nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206

Defendant Othel S Garland in court PRO SE.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 15 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Othel S Garland in court with attorney Amanda K. Ashley.  Dax Odom for Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

BRANCH 23 FOR BRANCH 04

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other Sentence and Count 2, with credit for 3 DAYS time served, with Huber privileges for work.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 2 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to Count 1 and any other sentence, with Huber privileges for work.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 30 DAYS (as to each count) in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program, or a course in anger management, based on evaluation.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-AODA assessment
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No VIOLENT contact with victim.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Br. 4 involved in a Jury Trial.  Matter transferred to Br. 23.
Court modified the contact order to allow defendant to visit child at the day care facility.  mld

Defendant Othel S Garland in court with attorney Amanda K. Ashley.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1 and COUNT #2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-14-2015 at 1:30 pm.  

Victim, Arlarkah G., appeared to request modification of the no contact order.  Court modified the no contact order to allow defendant to visit child at the day care facility.  mld

Defendant Othel S Garland in court with attorney Amanda K. Ashley.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court AMENDED the Charge of COUNT #1 to Battery (Domestic Abuse), Contrary to WIsconsin State Statute(s) 940.19(1) and 968.075(1)(a) a Class A Misdemeanor."   mld

Defendant Othel S Garland in court with attorney Amanda K. Ashley.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status Conference held off the record. Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 3-20-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld
Victim present in court requesting modification of the No Contact order. Court orders the No Contact order to remain.

Defendant Othel S Garland in court with attorney Amanda K. Ashley.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Due to Chief Judge directive, case reassigned to Judge Flanagan, branch 04, to follow ADA assigned to case. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 04.  Status conference scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Arlarkah G. and Porsha B.

Defendant Othel S Garland in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Othel S Garland in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY to count 2. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
